mind by the sight of the killed and wounded. At daybreak on the seventeenth, a French officer who had come with a flag of truce, de- manding an audience with the Russian Em- peror, was brought into Wischau from our out- 
posts. This officer was Savary. The Emperor had only just fallen asleep and so Savary had to wait. At midday he was admitted to the Em- peror, and an hour later he rode off with Prince Dolgoriikovtothe advanced post of the French army.
